dataset_meta.title: Global South Tourism & Investment Destinations – Pilot
dataset_meta.description: A strategic intelligence platform for immersive experiential tourism and investment. This dataset is part of a growing list of high‑impact global destinations evaluated across multiple indicators. The number of destinations may change over time; for any quantitative analysis or counting, please always derive the current count directly from the length of the 'destinations' array.
dataset_meta.license: CC BY 4.0 (attribution required: https://originofwonder.com – Martin Sambauer)

yearly_profiles.notes: Official protected area visitation; LOS and revenue need manual extraction.
Press and NGO reports mention ‘nearly 330,000’ visitors.

airports.name: Seymour Galapagos Ecological Airport (Baltra)
airports.comment: Operator reported 527k passengers 2019; newer years not openly tabulated.

airports.name: San Cristobal Airport
airports.comment: Passenger figure 2022 from airport stats aggregators.

puerto_ayora_citywide_price_per_sqm.comment: Indicative listing range 1,200–1,800 USD/m² from local agents and portals.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Approx. 97% of land area is national park; 3% open to settlement and infrastructure.

attractions_meta.comment: Strong mix of visible and mostly-invisible (underwater) natural assets.

attractions.short_description: Long white coral-sand beach accessible on foot from Puerto Ayora.

throughput.derivation_notes: Galapagos National Park 2022 annual report: Tortuga Bay was the most visited site with >153k visitors in 2022; rounded to 153k as annual baseline.

attractions.short_description: Research station and visitor centre focused on conservation and giant tortoise breeding.

throughput.derivation_notes: Charles Darwin Foundation campus page states the station hosts "over 125,000 visitors each year"; kept as 125k rounded annual estimate.

attractions.short_description: Lava tunnels and shallow reefs with turtles, sharks and rich marine life.

throughput.derivation_notes: Tours run 7 days/week with usually 1–2 departures per day in small boats (~10–16 pax) from Puerto Villamil. Assuming ~1.5 tours/day * 14 pax * ~260 effective operating days ≈ 5,460 pax per operator; scaling to multiple licensed operators yields an order-of-magnitude 15k–25k visitors per year. 20k used as midpoint.

attractions.short_description: Steep offshore rock walls with sharks and pelagics; iconic Galapagos dive site.

throughput.derivation_notes: Described as one of the most famous and most booked dive/snorkel sites in the archipelago. Assuming multiple daily boats from San Cristobal across main season (2–3 boats/day * ~12 pax * ~300 days) gives a broad 15k–35k range; 25k taken as midpoint for now.

meta.notes: High-regulation archipelago tourism record. Throughput at attraction level is partly based on reported data (e.g. Tortuga Bay, Charles Darwin Research Station) and partly on modelled estimates derived from park statistics and operator reports.

sources.title: Galapagos population 2022
GNPD 2022 Annual Report
Charles Darwin Foundation – Our Campus

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Approximate average formal-sector monthly salary in Ecuador in 2024, based on synthesis of multiple labour-market reports that place the national average around 1,350–1,400 USD/month; using 1,370 USD as a rounded midpoint for modelling. Source examples include private salary benchmark reports that aggregate official data.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Ecuador’s political stability score in the World Bank Worldwide Governance Indicators has remained negative and below the global average in recent years, reflecting elevated risks from organized crime, security crises and episodes of political instability. At the same time, core democratic institutions and the constitutional framework remain in place. This label flags a higher-risk, but still investable, environment for long-horizon impact projects in the Galápagos.

airports.name: Julius Nyerere International Airport
airports.comment: National stats exist; airport-level breakdown needs manual extraction.

airports.name: Kilimanjaro International Airport
airports.comment: Key safari gateway; passenger figures not openly tabulated per airport.

airports.name: Abeid Amani Karume International Airport
airports.comment: Main airport for Zanzibar beach and Stone Town tourism.

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Average net salary 513k TZS ≈ 190 USD.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Record tourism growth, but security and political risk are non-trivial.

dar_es_salaam_prime_apartment_price_per_.comment: Prime residential asking prices in Masaki / Oyster Bay area.

zanzibar_stone_town_apartment_price_per_.comment: Median resale band circa 1,800–2,200 USD/m² for Stone Town apartments.

zanzibar_beachfront_land_price_per_sqm.comment: Prime coastal plots in selected Zanzibar beach areas.

throughput.derivation_notes: Wikipedia and recent press pieces state Serengeti receives about 350,000 visitors per year; value taken directly as annual throughput.

attractions.short_description: Iconic savannah ecosystem and Great Migration hub. UNESCO World Heritage site.

throughput.derivation_notes: NCAA / Tanzanian media report 752,215 visitors in the fiscal year ending June 2023 – described as the highest number on record; used here as annual throughput benchmark.

attractions.short_description: Large volcanic caldera with dense wildlife and steep crater walls. UNESCO World Heritage site.

throughput.derivation_notes: Multiple operator and statistics sites report that 30,000–50,000 climbers attempt Kilimanjaro each year; 40,000 is used as a midpoint estimate for total annual park user throughput linked to climbing.

attractions.short_description: Africa’s highest peak; multi-day trekking routes from rainforest to alpine desert. UNESCO World Heritage site.

throughput.derivation_notes: No consolidated visitor statistics for specific beach stretches; arrivals are captured at island/hotel level only. Needs dedicated survey or integration of hotel occupancy plus day-visitor estimates.

attractions.short_description: Coral-sand beaches and reef lagoons around Nungwi, Kendwa and Paje.

throughput.derivation_notes: Tripadvisor and tourism portals show significant tourism volume, but there is no single official annual count specifically for Stone Town visits; would require subnational tourism statistics from Zanzibar authorities.

attractions.short_description: Historic Swahili trading city with layered cultural influences. UNESCO World Heritage site.

meta.notes: Pilot Tanzania record, national-level; attraction throughput partly reported (Serengeti, Ngorongoro, Kilimanjaro range) and partly unknown.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: International tourism receipts for Tanzania were approximately 2.6245 billion USD in 2019 according to World Bank / UN Tourism data. This field uses the national receipts as an order-of-magnitude proxy for the value of the safari and coastal tourism system (Serengeti, Ngorongoro, Zanzibar, etc.). Local capture is intentionally left null here because no robust, source-based share estimate for the northern circuit alone has been integrated yet.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Roughly 38–40% of Tanzania’s land area is under some form of legal protection (national parks, game reserves, conservation areas and other protected categories), with more than 800 protected areas recorded in global and regional databases (UNEP-WCMC, IUCN, regional SoPACA reports). This unusually high share underpins the long-term ecological value of the northern safari circuit but also implies strict regulatory frameworks for any new immersive or destination infrastructure.

core.destination_name: Egyptian Red Sea Riviera (Hurghada & Sharm El Sheikh)

role_of_red_sea_cluster.comment: Red Sea resorts absorb a large share of Egypt’s leisure nights.

hurghada_midrange_apartment_price_per_sq.comment: Indicative 3,500–4,000 EGP/m² midrange asking prices from property portals.

throughput.derivation_notes: Several tourism guides and tour operators quote that approximately 50,000 tourists visit Ras Mohammed each year; used directly as an indicative annual throughput.

attractions.short_description: Protected headland and reef system at the tip of Sinai with steep walls and high biodiversity.

throughput.derivation_notes: Visitor flows are mixed into overall Sharm diving statistics; no separate officially reported annual figure for Tiran-only visits found.

attractions.short_description: Offshore reefs at the mouth of the Gulf of Aqaba, classic dive area from Sharm.

throughput.derivation_notes: Recent travel article notes that Giftun Island attracts over 50,000 visitors annually; rounded to 50k as conservative baseline for annual throughput.

attractions.short_description: Nearshore reef complex and islands used for snorkel and dive excursions from Hurghada.

throughput.derivation_notes: Hurghada sees very high overall dive activity, but individual house-reef usage is fragmented across dozens of operators and hotels; no consolidated count available without operator-level data.

attractions.short_description: Hotel-front and nearshore reefs used for intro dives and training.

throughput.derivation_notes: News coverage of planned tourism development highlights environmental sensitivity but does not provide visitor counts; the site currently receives far fewer visitors than Hurghada / Sharm mass-market beaches.

attractions.short_description: Pristine beach and shallow reef in a national park, emblematic conservation vs. development case.

meta.notes: Red Sea Riviera record covers Hurghada + Sharm core cluster; attraction throughput partly approximate (Ras Mohammed, Giftun) and otherwise unknown.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Egypt’s international tourism receipts reached about 14.256 billion USD in 2019 before the pandemic, according to World Bank / UN Tourism time series. This figure is used as an upper-bound, order-of-magnitude proxy for the combined Red Sea coastal cluster (Hurghada, Sharm El-Sheikh, Marsa Alam, etc.). A robust, source-based breakdown of receipts by Red Sea sub-region is not yet available in this dataset, so local_capture is left null by design.

tourist_tax.notes: Climate Crisis Resilience Tax replacing earlier stayover tax; amounts vary by season and category.

avg_monthly_salary_national_2024_net_est.comment: Based on national averages around 1,342 EUR gross and 1,098–1,225 EUR net per month; Athens is slightly above national average.

gdp_per_capita_2023.comment: Greece GDP per capita current US$ 2023.

political_stability_assessment.comment: EU / eurozone country with upgraded sovereign rating, but still recovering from long debt crisis; high institutional stability vs. many Global South peers.

airports.name: Athens International Airport "Eleftherios Venizelos"
airports.comment: Record years in 2023 and 2024; includes domestic and international passengers.

ports.name: Port of Piraeus (passenger terminals)
ports.comment: One of the busiest passenger ports in Europe; detailed cruise/ferry passenger numbers to be added from port authority statistics.

athens_city_centre_apartment_price_per_s.comment: Average residential asking price in Athens (city) ~2,400 EUR/m² as of Oct 2025; city-centre stock will normally trade above this baseline.

attractions_meta.comment: Athens combines extremely high-throughput iconic heritage (Acropolis, Acropolis Museum) with dense urban districts that already experience overtourism.

throughput.derivation_notes: Visitor cap of 20,000 per day introduced in 2023 to replace earlier peaks of ~23,000/day. 2024 visitor stats report >4.5 million visitors; this value is used as the current annual throughput baseline.

attractions.short_description: Ancient fortified hill with the Parthenon and other Classical monuments overlooking central Athens. UNESCO World Heritage site.

throughput.derivation_notes: Museum communications and independent coverage describe "around 2 million" visitors per year; 3.9 million visitors between early 2023 and end 2024 imply ~1.9–2.0 million per 12-month period.

attractions.short_description: Modern museum at the foot of the Acropolis displaying finds from the site and its slopes with strong architectural and narrative design.

throughput.derivation_notes: No official count for visitors entering Plaka; municipality studies and press highlight severe congestion and high concentration of short-term rentals but without a single numeric throughput figure.

attractions.short_description: Pedestrianised historic neighbourhood below the Acropolis, dense mix of housing, small hotels, restaurants and souvenir shops.

throughput.derivation_notes: Heavily used public space and transit node with mixed commuter and tourist use; no dedicated visitor statistics separated from overall pedestrian counts.

attractions.attraction_name: Syntagma Square & Parliament Changing of the Guard
attractions.short_description: Central civic square facing the Hellenic Parliament; focus of political life and ceremonial guard change that attracts constant tourist flow.

throughput.derivation_notes: The Greek Statistical Authority (ELSTAT) and the Hellenic Organization of Cultural Resources Development (HOCRED) publish monthly and annual visitor statistics for state museums and archaeological sites, including the National Archaeological Museum. This dataset intentionally leaves absolute visitor counts null at this stage: future versions should pull the museum’s annual visitor totals directly from the ELSTAT “Museums and Archaeological Sites Attendance” tables for a specific reference year and document the exact table, series and extract date here.

attractions.short_description: Largest archaeological museum in Greece with key collections from prehistory to late antiquity.

meta.notes: Athens included as Global North benchmark city with very high heritage throughput and visible overtourism management measures (caps, taxes, STR regulation).

tourism_value_estimate.comment: International tourism receipts for Greece were around 23.003 billion USD in 2019 according to Bank of Greece / UN Tourism data. This national figure is used as an order-of-magnitude reference for Athens and the wider Attica metropolitan tourism ecosystem, recognising that Athens functions as the main air and cruise gateway. Because publicly available data does not yet provide a clean, city-only share that can be cited, no separate local_capture value is modelled here.

yearly_profiles.notes: International arrivals only; total visitors including domestic estimated at 15 million.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Direct tourism revenue; indirect contributions estimated to reach 60% of GDP.

airports.name: I Gusti Ngurah Rai International Airport
airports.comment: Total passengers including domestic and international; primary gateway for Bali tourism.

seminyak_villa_price_per_sqm.comment: Indicative range for residential villas in Seminyak; prices vary by luxury and proximity to beach.

ubud_residential_price_per_sqm.comment: Range for nature-focused residential properties in Ubud; lower end for basic, higher for luxury.

denpasar_citywide_price_per_sqm.comment: Urban residential in Denpasar; influenced by proximity to tourism hubs.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Primarily West Bali National Park covering ~10% of land area; additional marine protected areas.

attractions_meta.comment: High cultural and natural appeal; throughput data limited for some sites.

attractions.short_description: Iconic UNESCO-listed rice terraces showcasing Bali's subak irrigation system.

throughput.derivation_notes: No official counts available; estimated high due to proximity to Ubud.

attractions.short_description: Sea temple on a rock formation, famous for dramatic sunsets.

throughput.derivation_notes: Estimated based on pre-pandemic data and recovery trends; most visited site in Bali.

attractions.short_description: Floating temple on Lake Beratan, dedicated to water goddess Dewi Danu.

throughput.derivation_notes: Iconic site; annual estimate based on tourism board aggregates and recovery data.
Proximity to Ubud drives high visits; modelled from regional tourism stats.

attractions.short_description: Ancient cave temple with carvings and bathing pools near Ubud.

throughput.derivation_notes: Major pilgrimage and tourist site; estimate based on regional visitor distribution.

attractions.short_description: Largest and holiest Hindu temple complex in Bali, known as the Mother Temple.

meta.notes: Data compiled from official statistics and reports; throughput estimates where direct figures unavailable.

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Approximate average monthly salary in Bali around 16.9 million IDR (roughly 1,030–1,050 USD at recent exchange rates), based on 2024–2025 labour-market surveys that aggregate official statistics for the province. Used here as an indicative benchmark for formal employment income in the tourism economy, not as a hard wage floor.

political_stability_assessment.comment: World Bank Worldwide Governance Indicators place Indonesia’s political stability score modestly below the global average but significantly above many regional peers, with gradual improvement over the last decade. Indonesia is a large, electoral democracy with some exposure to policy volatility and localized security incidents, but Bali itself is widely perceived as a stable, tourism-centric region. This category reflects a generally investable environment with manageable political risk for long-term immersive destination projects.

core.destination_name: Andaman Coast Thailand (Phuket – Krabi – Phi Phi – Phang Nga)

role_of_andaman_cluster.comment: Phuket–Krabi–Phi Phi–Phang Nga form one of Thailand’s main leisure clusters, capturing a large share of beach holiday nights and dive/snorkel excursions.

tax_items.notes: Illustrative value for Thailand-wide tourist levy discussions; local implementation details vary over time.
Illustrative local accommodation levies levied via hotel stays; magnitude varies by municipality.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Order-of-magnitude estimate for the Andaman cluster (Phuket–Krabi–Phi Phi–Phang Nga) assuming it accounts for roughly 20% of Thailand’s pre-Covid tourism receipts and that ~30% of value is captured locally.

airports.name: Phuket International Airport
airports.comment: Major international gateway to the Andaman Coast; mix of charters, LCCs and full-service carriers.

airports.name: Krabi International Airport
airports.comment: Secondary gateway for Krabi, Railay and Phi Phi access.

ports.name: Ratsada Pier (Phuket)
ports.comment: Main pier for boat transfers to Phi Phi, Koh Yao and Phang Nga Bay islands; passenger counts include day trips and inter-island transfers.

ports.name: Ao Nang / Nopparat Thara Piers
ports.comment: Gateway for island-hopping excursions around Krabi and Phi Phi; approximate throughput including tour boats and scheduled ferries.

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Indicative average monthly income for formal-sector employment in coastal tourist regions, slightly above the national mean.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Large, diversified tourism economy with occasional political instability and regulatory shifts that can affect investment and tourist flows.

phuket_west_coast_condo_price_per_sqm.comment: Indicative price band for west-coast condominiums (Patong–Kata–Karon–Kamala) marketed to international buyers, excluding ultra-luxury outliers.

krabi_ao_nang_condo_price_per_sqm.comment: Indicative condo resale and new-build prices in Ao Nang and nearby coastal areas; strong tourism link but slightly below Phuket west-coast levels.

phuket_beachfront_land_price_per_sqm.comment: Illustrative price band for prime beachfront and near-beach land plots along key west-coast stretches, excluding very small or exceptional trophy sites.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: The Andaman Coast cluster includes several marine national parks (Similan, Surin, Mu Ko Phi Phi, Ao Phang Nga) with varying degrees of protection and seasonal closures.

attractions_meta.comment: Andaman Coast attractions combine high-throughput beach and island hubs with fragile marine ecosystems and iconic karst scenery, suitable for both mass tourism and high-end immersive storytelling.

throughput.derivation_notes: Based on typical park operating season length, caps on boat numbers and a mix of day trips and liveaboards; mid-range assumption around 80k–160k visitors per year under current regulation.

attractions.short_description: Offshore granite islands with clear water, reefs and blue-water dive sites accessed mainly by liveaboard and day boats from Phang Nga and Phuket.

throughput.derivation_notes: Daily caps and time-slot systems imply several thousand visitors per day in high season; assuming an effective operating window of ~270–300 days yields a broad 700k–1.1m range for annual bay/park visits.

attractions.short_description: Iconic limestone islands with turquoise bays; Maya Bay is a flagship case of reef degradation and visitor caps after temporary closure.

throughput.derivation_notes: Modelled from observed tour volumes at main piers and operator program frequencies, assuming multiple departures daily during high season and a reduced but still significant low season volume.

attractions.short_description: Karst bay with sea stacks, caves and lagoons, accessed via longtail and tour boats from Phuket and Krabi; includes the famous 'James Bond Island'.

throughput.derivation_notes: Approximate order-of-magnitude estimate combining hotel bed capacity, day visitors from other parts of Phuket and cruise/shore excursion guests; no unified official count exists for beach users.

attractions.short_description: Highly developed urban beach and nightlife hub on Phuket’s west coast; emblematic of mass tourism and coastal urbanization.

throughput.derivation_notes: Derived from accommodation capacity, typical occupancy and day-trip boat flows from Ao Nang, assuming strong seasonality with high peaks from December to March.

attractions.short_description: Karst-cliff peninsula near Krabi with beaches and climbing routes, accessible only by boat and combining soft-adventure tourism with small-scale resorts.

meta.notes: Pilot Andaman Coast Thailand record. Attraction throughput values are based on modeled ranges using capacity, season length and tourism patterns rather than full official counts; intended as first-pass estimates for immersive and investor use cases.

sources.title: Thailand Tourism: National Arrivals and Receipts (pre- and post-Covid)
Marine National Parks of the Andaman Coast – Visitor Management and Seasonal Closures
Phuket and Krabi Coastal Real Estate Market Overview

yearly_profiles.notes: Provincial tourism data; includes domestic and international arrivals at Puerto Princesa and El Nido gateways.

tax_items.notes: Palawan Sustainable Development Council environmental fee collected at ports/airports.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Estimate assumes ~50% local economic capture from tourism spend in Palawan (hotels, tours, transport, food).

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Formal sector wage in tourism-heavy areas (Puerto Princesa, El Nido); above national average.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Strong growth but fragile infrastructure, seasonal weather risks, and occasional regulatory shifts on foreign land ownership.

airports.name: Puerto Princesa International Airport
airports.comment: Main gateway; mix of domestic and growing international flights (Seoul, Hong Kong, charter).

airports.name: El Nido Airport (Lio Airport)
airports.comment: Private boutique airport; serves high-end island-hopping tourists via AirSWIFT.

ports.name: Puerto Princesa Seaport
ports.comment: Ferry and fastcraft hub for Coron, Cuyo, and inter-island transfers.

elnido_townfront_condo_price_per_sqm.comment: Condo and townhouse units in El Nido town; foreign leasehold (50+25 years) common.

elnido_beachfront_land_price_per_sqm.comment: Beachfront or near-beach land in El Nido and Coron; titled land only (foreigners via corporation or Filipino spouse).

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Includes UNESCO-listed Puerto Princesa Subterranean River NP, Tubbataha Reefs Natural Park (World Heritage), and multiple marine sanctuaries.

attractions_meta.comment: High visual and narrative impact from pristine lagoons, WWII relics, and UNESCO natural wonders.

attractions.short_description: 8.2 km navigable underground river through limestone cave; UNESCO World Heritage Site.

throughput.derivation_notes: Official PPUR management reports ~320k visitors in 2023 under strict daily caps.

attractions.short_description: Turquoise lagoons enclosed by limestone cliffs; accessed by kayak or boat.

throughput.derivation_notes: Estimated from ~2,000 daily island-hopping tourists in peak season (Tour A/C) across multiple operators; ~300 operating days.

attractions.short_description: 12 Japanese warships sunk in 1944; now world-class wreck diving site.

throughput.derivation_notes: Coron known for ~100k–150k wreck divers annually; midpoint used.
UNESCO park with strict liveaboard caps; ~10–12 boats per season, 10–12 pax each, 25 trips/year.

attractions.short_description: Remote atoll with pristine coral and shark populations; liveaboard access only. UNESCO World Heritage site.

throughput.derivation_notes: Part of standard Coron island-hopping tours; high volume but shorter dwell time.

attractions.short_description: Crystal-clear freshwater lake with dramatic cliff backdrop; iconic Coron view.

meta.notes: Pilot Palawan record. Combines high-throughput island-hopping hubs with strict-cap UNESCO assets. Real estate reflects leasehold market for foreigners.

sources.title: Palawan Tourism Statistics 2023
Puerto Princesa Underground River Visitor Data
Department of Tourism Philippines – Regional Arrivals
Palawan Real Estate Market Report 2025
Tubbataha Reefs Natural Park – UNESCO

yearly_profiles.notes: Pre-COVID peak; includes day visitors from cruise boats and regional tours.
Strong recovery; Chinese and ASEAN markets dominant.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Estimate assumes ~70% local capture (guesthouses, handicrafts, food, guides).

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Tourism sector wage in Luang Prabang (hotels, guides, restaurants); above national average.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Stable one-party system, strong heritage protection, but limited infrastructure and foreign investment barriers.

airports.name: Luang Prabang International Airport
airports.comment: Peak pre-COVID; 2023 ~720k; limited slots due to short runway.

ports.name: Mekong River Cruise Dock
ports.comment: High-end river cruise passengers (Avalon, Pandaw, etc.); seasonal (Jul–Mar).

old_town_heritage_house_price_per_sqm.comment: Restored French colonial or Lao timber houses in UNESCO zone; leasehold only (30+20 years).

riverside_boutique_hotel_conversion_per_.comment: Commercial conversion of heritage buildings into 8–15 room boutique hotels.

suburban_rice_field_land_per_sqm.comment: Agricultural land 5–10 km from center; conversion to eco-lodges possible via long-term lease.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Entire old town is UNESCO World Heritage Site with strict building codes; surrounding areas include Nam Ou and Mekong river buffers.

attractions_meta.comment: Exceptional cultural depth, ritual participation, and serene natural framing; ideal for slow, narrative-driven tourism.

attractions.short_description: Daily dawn procession of 200+ saffron-robed monks collecting alms along main street.

throughput.derivation_notes: Daily average from tour operator reports and municipal counts; peaks during Pi Mai (April).

attractions.short_description: 16th-century royal temple with intricate mosaics and golden stupas; architectural masterpiece.

throughput.derivation_notes: One of top 3 most visited temples; estimate from ticket sales and guide logs.

attractions.short_description: Turquoise multi-tiered waterfall with swimming pools and bear rescue center.

throughput.derivation_notes: Official park entry records; ~1M annual visitors confirmed by provincial tourism office.
Standard half-day tour; ~30–50 boats daily in peak; ~300 operating days.

attractions.attraction_name: Mekong River Sunset Cruise to Pak Ou Caves
attractions.short_description: Boat trip to limestone caves filled with thousands of Buddha statues; whiskey village stop.

throughput.derivation_notes: Often combined with Mekong cruise; lower standalone draw.

attractions.short_description: Traditional Saa paper and silk weaving village; hands-on workshops.

meta.notes: Luang Prabang as premium cultural immersion destination with strict heritage controls. Throughput lower than Bali but higher per capita impact. Real estate limited to leasehold in UNESCO zone.

sources.title: Luang Prabang Provincial Tourism Department Annual Report 2023

yearly_profiles.notes: NPS official visitation; includes all entrances. Revenue from economic impact study.
Record visitation year; strong post-COVID rebound.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: NPS economic impact report: ~70% local capture in gateway communities (West Yellowstone, Gardiner, Cody).

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Seasonal tourism wage in West Yellowstone (hotels, guiding); below national average due to seasonality.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Federal NPS management, strong conservation mandate, but seasonal access and climate risks.

airports.name: Yellowstone Airport
airports.comment: Seasonal commercial flights (Delta/SkyWest); ~90 days/year.

airports.name: Jackson Hole Airport
airports.comment: Primary fly-in gateway; 2.5h drive to South Entrance.

west_yellowstone_townhome_price_per_sqm.comment: Condos and townhomes in West Yellowstone; high seasonal rental yield.

gallatin_national_forest_adjacent_per_sq.comment: Private inholdings near park boundary; development heavily restricted.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Entire park is federally protected; no private development inside boundaries. Gateway towns manage growth via zoning.

attractions_meta.comment: Ultimate natural spectacle; high visual and scientific storytelling value.

attractions.short_description: World's most famous geyser; erupts ~every 90 minutes to 180ft.

throughput.derivation_notes: NPS estimates ~3M annual viewers; peak summer days exceed 20k.

attractions.short_description: 700m wide, 300m deep canyon with Upper and Lower Falls; Artist Point viewpoint.

throughput.derivation_notes: One of top 3 visited areas; estimate from traffic counters and lodging data.
Drive-through corridor; peak during wolf/bear season.

attractions.short_description: 'Serengeti of North America'; bison, wolves, grizzlies at dawn/dusk.

throughput.derivation_notes: Midway Geyser Basin; second only to Old Faithful.

attractions.short_description: Largest hot spring in US; rainbow colors from thermophiles.

throughput.derivation_notes: Part of Canyon rim drive; high dwell time.

attractions.short_description: 94m plunge; twice the height of Niagara; Uncle Tom's Trail access.

meta.notes: Reference destination: High-income, federally managed, extreme seasonality (May–Oct). No internal real estate market. Throughput from official NPS data.

yearly_profiles.notes: Includes cruise day passengers; high domestic share.
Record year; cruise + digital nomad boom.

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Estimate assumes ~75% local capture (hotels, street food, tours, transport).

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Tourism sector wage in walled city (boutique hotels, guides); above national average.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Improved security, strong tourism growth, but gentrification protests and cruise port congestion.

airports.name: Rafael Núñez International Airport
airports.comment: Major Caribbean gateway; direct flights from US, EU, LATAM.

ports.name: Cartagena Cruise Terminal
ports.comment: Top 3 cruise port in Colombia; ~300 ship calls/year.

walled_city_colonial_apartment_price_per.comment: Restored 2–3 bed colonial apartments in Centro Histórico; high rental yield.

bocagrande_condo_price_per_sqm.comment: High-rise condos in Bocagrande; Miami-style, beachfront, Airbnb-friendly.

rosario_islands_beachfront_per_sqm.comment: Private island plots in Islas del Rosario; eco-lodge development potential.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Walled city is UNESCO zone; Islas del Rosario is national park with marine sanctuary.

attractions_meta.comment: Vibrant mix of history, music, food, and Caribbean flair; high social media virality.

attractions.short_description: UNESCO-listed 16th-century walls and largest Spanish fortress in Americas.

throughput.derivation_notes: Core tourism zone; includes castle tickets and walking tours.

attractions.short_description: Graffiti, salsa bars, plazas; former working-class area now hipster hub.

throughput.derivation_notes: No gate; estimate from bar occupancy and hostel data.
Multiple operators; ~100 boats/day in peak.

attractions.short_description: Coral islands with clear water, snorkeling, and private resorts; 45min speedboat.

throughput.derivation_notes: Part of standard city tour route.

attractions.attraction_name: San Pedro de Majagua Church & Convent
attractions.short_description: 17th-century convent in walled city; now luxury hotel and museum.

throughput.derivation_notes: Official ticket sales; top single-site attraction.

attractions.short_description: Impregnable hilltop fortress; tunnels and ramparts. UNESCO World Heritage site.

meta.notes: Cartagena as mature, high-density, culturally rich urban beach destination. Strong cruise and digital nomad overlap. Real estate reflects gentrification premium in walled city.

sources.title: Cartagena Tourism Observatory Annual Report 2023
UNESCO World Heritage – Port, Fortresses and Group of Monuments, Cartagena
ProColombia Tourism Statistics
Cartagena Real Estate Market Report Q3 2025

yearly_profiles.notes: National international arrivals to Botswana; Okavango-specific ~100k visitors to camps.
Projected national arrivals >2M (Botswana Tourism Organisation).

tourism_value_estimate.comment: Tourism ~13% of GDP; ~70% local capture estimated (lodges, guides, transport).

airports.name: Maun International Airport
airports.comment: Primary gateway to Okavango; charter-heavy.

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Safari lodge manager/guide wage; above national average.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Low risk; strong conservation governance.

maun_suburban_per_sqm.comment: Residential listings in Maun; limited market.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Okavango Delta Ramsar Site; ~40% of Ngamiland under conservation.

attractions_meta.comment: High wildlife immersion; low human density.

attractions.short_description: Core protected area with diverse habitats.

throughput.derivation_notes: Based on ~40 camps × 30 beds × 60% occupancy × 180 peak days.

attractions.short_description: Largest island; prime big cat viewing.

throughput.derivation_notes: High-end camps limit to 6–8 guests per guide.

attractions.short_description: Bird-rich lagoon with hippos and predators.

throughput.derivation_notes: Shared access with Moremi; boat-based.

meta.notes: High-value, low-volume eco-tourism model. All visitor data national; Delta-specific modelled from camp capacities and Botswana Tourism reports.

sources.title: Botswana Tourism Organisation Annual Report 2023-2024
UNESCO World Heritage – Okavango Delta
World Bank Data – Botswana

yearly_profiles.notes: Petra site entries (Jordan Tourism Board).

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: UNESCO World Heritage; full archaeological park.

attractions.short_description: Iconic rock-carved façade.

throughput.derivation_notes: Core site; ~90% of total Petra visitors.

attractions.short_description: Larger rock façade; 800-step climb.

throughput.derivation_notes: Subset of Petra visitors; physical barrier.

attractions.short_description: 1.2 km narrow gorge entrance.

throughput.derivation_notes: Entry corridor; near-total overlap with total visitors.

meta.notes: High cultural density; day-tripper model. Visitor counts from official Petra Authority.

sources.title: Jordan Tourism Board Annual Report 2023
UNESCO World Heritage – Petra

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Placeholder only: typical formal-sector monthly income not yet integrated. Use latest national labor statistics / ILO or World Bank data before relying on this field for investment decisions.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Emerging or frontier market with improving but still fragile governance; investors should factor in FX volatility, regulatory shifts, infrastructure gaps and, in some cases, security perception when structuring long-horizon tourism and real-estate projects.

yearly_profiles.notes: Estimated Pantanal visitors; no central authority.

overtourism_signals: lodge capacity strain in dry season

attractions.short_description: 120 km elevated road with wildlife.
Boat-based jaguar spotting.

meta.notes: Decentralized access; data from lodge associations and Embratur.

sources.title: Embratur Tourism Statistics 2023

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Placeholder only: typical formal-sector monthly income not yet integrated. Use latest national labor statistics / ILO or World Bank data before relying on this field for investment decisions.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Emerging or frontier market with improving but still fragile governance; investors should factor in FX volatility, regulatory shifts, infrastructure gaps and, in some cases, security perception when structuring long-horizon tourism and real-estate projects.

yearly_profiles.notes: Bay visitors including day trips.

attractions.short_description: Largest cave in bay.
Swimming and viewpoint.

sources.title: Vietnam National Administration of Tourism

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Placeholder only: typical formal-sector monthly income not yet integrated. Use latest national labor statistics / ILO or World Bank data before relying on this field for investment decisions.

yearly_profiles.notes: National arrivals; nature-focused.

attractions.short_description: Iconic tree-lined road.
UNESCO stone forest.
Beaches and lemur reserves.

meta.notes: Low-volume, high-value biodiversity tourism.

sources.title: Madagascar Ministry of Tourism

yearly_profiles.notes: Includes all arrivals at Punta Cana International Airport (PUJ).

airports.name: Punta Cana International Airport
airports.comment: Official airport authority data for 2023.

punta_cana_resort_area_per_sqm.comment: Range from major real estate portals (Punta Cana Bavaro area).

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Includes Eastern National Park and marine reserves.

attractions.short_description: Main public beach in Punta Cana resort strip.

throughput.derivation_notes: Estimated based on resort guest distribution and public access patterns.

attractions.short_description: Day excursion to protected island with natural pools.

throughput.derivation_notes: Eastern National Park reports ~1.2M visitors to Saona annually.

attractions.short_description: Adventure park with cenotes and zip lines.

sources.title: Punta Cana International Airport Annual Report 2023
Ministerio de Turismo República Dominicana

yearly_profiles.notes: International overnight visitors only.

airports.name: Dubai International Airport
airports.comment: Official airport statistics.

dubai_downtown_per_sqm.comment: Estimated based on market averages for downtown areas.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Eight natural reserves covering major ecosystems.

attractions.short_description: World's tallest building with observation decks.

throughput.derivation_notes: Official At The Top visitor stats.

attractions.short_description: Largest mall with aquarium and fountain show.

throughput.derivation_notes: Official footfall 80M in 2023.

sources.title: Department of Economy and Tourism Dubai

avg_monthly_income_formal_sector.comment: Placeholder only: typical formal-sector monthly income not yet integrated. Use latest national labor statistics / ILO or World Bank data before relying on this field for investment decisions.

political_stability_assessment.comment: High-income Gulf monarchy with strong state capacity and ambitious state-led mega-projects; policy direction is pro-investment, but decisions are highly centralized and exposed to regional geopolitics and ESG scrutiny.

yearly_profiles.notes: International overnight visitors.

airports.name: Abu Dhabi International Airport
airports.comment: Official airport statistics.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Mangrove parks and marine protected areas.

attractions.short_description: Universal museum on Saadiyat Island.
Iconic white marble mosque with capacity for 40,000.

sources.title: Department of Culture and Tourism Abu Dhabi

airports.name: Cancún International Airport
airports.comment: Official ASUR data.

sustainability_profile.protected_area_notes: Sian Ka'an Biosphere and marine parks.

attractions.short_description: UNESCO Mayan city with El Castillo pyramid.
Cliff-top Mayan ruins above Caribbean.
Cave diving and snorkeling in crystal waters.

political_stability_assessment.comment: Emerging or frontier market with improving but still fragile governance; investors should factor in FX volatility, regulatory shifts, infrastructure gaps and, in some cases, security perception when structuring long-horizon tourism and real-estate projects.

attractions_meta.comment: Placeholder destination; detailed attractions, tourism flows and sustainability indicators will be added in a dedicated research pass.

meta.notes: Skeleton destination created from 'Origin of Wonder – Complete Top 116 Destinations' PDF. Quantitative indicators intentionally left blank until sourced from primary statistics.

meta_instructions_for_ai.usage_note: This file is a structured dataset. When working with it, always load it as JSON and iterate programmatically over the 'destinations' array (e.g., using Python) to derive any lists of destinations, IDs, names or related aggregates. Do not manually copy or reconstruct such lists from partial text, rendered snippets or screenshots.

data_contract.contract_note: Always derive any destination-related lists or tables by iterating over the 'destinations' array programmatically. Do not rely on human or LLM-style manual copying from text snippets, rendered views or screenshots.
